page.title: 03Public Houses of Elburton
page.content:
Mr. Strawbridge is the manager of the "Ships Tavern and Kings Head". It is positioned very near the main shopping area of Elburton village. It was built in the 17th century and was first used as a cider house with apple orchards around it. It is split into two pubs but is under the same management. The Kings Head is the old part of the pub. The Ships Tavern is the restaurant.
Mr.Edwards is the manager of "The Elburton". It is 80_90 years old. It is positioned along the A379 on a busy crossroads. On the windows it says "Elburton Hotel" but it is not a hotel so Mr.Edwards would like to change them, but he is not allowed to because of their value.
